thread.title: If Mets face Cubs in NLCS, Matt Harvey can start this many times
thread.title_full: If Mets face Cubs in NLCS, Matt Harvey can start this many times | NJ.com

author: Mike Vorkunov | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: If Mets face Cubs in NLCS, Matt Harvey can start this many times
text:
NEW YORK — If the Mets advance to the National League Championship Series against the Cubs, they'll have Matt Harvey for a normal slate of starts. Manager Terry Collins said he saw no reason why Harvey wouldn't be able to make two starts in the series.
Harvey pitched Game 3 of the National League Division Series against the Dodgers and would line up to pitch Game 1 or 2 of the NLCS.
RELATED: Mets' Terry Collins reacts to timing of Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley's appeal And, of course, there are some reasons why he wouldn't be able to. Harvey started Game 3 because he could only make one start this round. There was also the whole brouhaha involving Harvey and his agent, Scott Boras, last month when they said doctors had recommended he doesn't pitch more than 180 innings this year -- his first back after Tommy John surgery.
Harvey removed himself from those limits late last month and ended up throwing 189 1/3 innings this season, with five more Monday night.
"You guys think I plan this out, map this out – I don't," Collins said." "The only thing I mapped out is when we talked about Matt Harvey pitching in the playoffs when we were going through that whole situation about 180 innings and this and that and we talked about him pitching in the playoffs, I said hey look, in the first round he's probably going to get one start so what game is it going to be? That's as far looking into the future as we went."
Harvey won't be available to the Mets out of the bullpen in Game 5 , although the pitcher had expressed an interest in that Sunday.
"Oh God no," Collins said. "No."
